alert.note: Alert for Fairfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 29 at 5:39PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southern Connecticut, including the following counties, Fairfield and New Haven. Portions of southeast New York, including the following county, Westchester. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 539 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges rain and elevated stream flows from the heavy rain from earlier. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 2.5 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bridgeport, New Haven, Waterbury, Norwalk, Danbury, Milford, Shelton, Naugatuck, Southbury, Wolcott, Sherman, Newtown, Fairfield, Hamden, Stratford, Trumbull, Cheshire, Westport, Ridgefield and Monroe. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
